item.title: West Midlands Police officer convicted of assaults
item.description: The police watchdog says there is no evidence to support complaints the attacks were racially driven.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Concern over 'extremist' knifeman before release
item.description: Sudesh Amman stabbed two people before being shot by police on a south London street last year.

item.title: Tonnes of chalk fall in Beachy Head collapse
item.description: A major collapse of cliffs at Beachy Head has cut off an access path to the Belle Tout lighthouse.

item.title: Charlotte Worthington: Family hope Olympic gold inspires others
item.description: Charlotte Worthington's parents hope her BMX freestyle Olympic gold inspires others.

item.title: Warmley baby death: Father guilty of murder and mother cleared
item.description: James Clark is convicted of killing baby Sean who died with 71 rib fractures and head injuries.

item.title: NHS Covid-19 app in England and Wales tweaked to notify fewer contacts
item.description: The app in England and Wales will now only alert contacts from the previous two days in asymptomatic cases.

item.title: Brands Hatch: Robert Foote named as marshal killed in crash
item.description: Former mayor Robert Foote has been named locally as the man who died in a crash at the race circuit.

item.title: Cotheridge murder-accused 'staged love rival's suicide'
item.description: Neil Parkinson was found dead in a burning car in Cotheridge, Worcestershire, in December.

item.title: Men in 2014 Lowestoft boat accident died after vessel capsized
item.description: Andrew Porter and Malcolm Sayer have never been found after their boat capsized in 2014.

item.title: Tax fraudster ordered to repay Â£5.5m within three months
item.description: Stanley Miller had multiple bank accounts and a property portfolio after evading tax, police say.

item.title: London Underground: Union calls off two 24-hour strikes
item.description: A further two days of strike action remain planned for the end of August, the RMT union says.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Man builds squirrel course in Hitchin garden
item.description: Steve Barley spent almost three months building the course, designed around events in a heptathlon.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: Video: Eggborough Power Station cooling towers demolished
item.description: The 300ft (90m) high structures in Eggborough were demolished as part of a plan to redevelop the site.

item.title: 'Erotic, maybe a bit sexy, but not pornographic'
item.description: Alison Walker signed up for a boudoir photoshoot before having a double mastectomy.

item.title: The autism-friendly toy shop: 'We have got this'
item.description: Retail worker Romilly, who is autistic, wants to create a comfortable space for other autistic people to shop in.

item.title: Dorset photographer shoots Star Wars Lego in cinematic style
item.description: A 34-year-old Dorset photographer is recreating cinematic sci-fi scenes using his Star Wars Lego kits.

item.title: 'Bennerley Viaduct has Facebook followers in Germany'
item.description: The Victorian rail bridge was almost demolished but now has fans all over the world.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team eventing gold, silver medals for Tom McEwen and Emily Campbell
item.description: Great Britain win a first Olympic team eventing gold since 1972, with silver medals for Tom McEwen and weightlifter Emily Campbell.

item.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham striker fails to show up to Spurs' training ground
item.description: Harry Kane, a transfer target for Manchester City, fails to return to the Tottenham training ground as expected on Monday morning amid speculation over his future.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root says 'I just want my friend to be OK' after Ben Stokes takes break
item.description: Ben Stokes has "an opportunity to put himself first", says England Test captain Joe Root as the all-rounder takes an indefinite break from cricket.
